intro: Phyla nodiflora var. galapagensis, commonly known as the Galápagos beach morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid and saline conditions of its native habitat. This variety is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for local fauna.
